climbs.name: Walk Like an Egyptian
climbs.fa: Brad Young, Joel Primrose, Duncan Masland, Shanna Hoversten, Jeff Germain, April 24, 2021

content.description:
Walk Like an Egyptian climbs a shallow up-and-left ramp on the steep face to the left of Ra Ra (listed next).  Reach it by climbing past the first two bolts on Ra Ra. Step left to a stance.  Five bolts on the headwall protect the ramp.  The last of these protects moves over a bulge, onto a narrowing, north-facing slab (now 10 feet left and down from Ra Ra’s sixth bolt).  Another bolt to the left (eight lead bolts total) protects the slab. Finish at a three-bolt anchor above a nearly-flat stance (the anchor is shared with the next three routes, Ra Ra, Tut Tut, and Hieroglyphics).

Descend by rappelling 55 feet (there is no walk off).
content.location: This unique route shares a start with Ra Ra. To find both routes, look for a fairly steep, 20 foot wide, west-facing slab with a steep headwall to its left (north). The headwall includes a prominent but fairly shallow up-and-left ramp.

climbs.name: Tut Tut
climbs.fa: Brad Young, Joel Primrose, Shanna Hoversten, Duncan Masland, Mike Germain, Jeff Germain, December 2, 2020

content.description: The crack-to-face between Ra Ra and the prominent left-facing corner (which is the route Hieroglyphics).  A fixed piton and tiny to one inch gear protect moves to the top of the crack.  The face above is protected by four bolts (the last shared with Ra Ra).  Finish at the shared three-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Tiny to one inch, one fixed pin and four bolts.
content.location: Climb the middle of the 20 foot wide, west-facing slab that is the most prominent feature of the middle part of Pinecrest Lake Buttress.

climbs.name: Ra Ra
climbs.fa: Brad Young, Shanna Hoversten, Duncan Masland, Jeff Germain, October 25, 2020

content.description: Ra Ra climbs the left edge of a fairly steep, 20 foot wide, west-facing slab with a steep headwall to its left (north). Seven bolts protect 55 feet of climbing on rock that is surprisingly slick in places.  Step left at the fifth bolt.  Finish up a narrowing, north-facing slab with two bolts to finish at the shared three-bolt anchor.
content.location: Ra Ra climbs the left edge of the 20 foot wide, west-facing slab that is the most prominent feature of the middle part of Pinecrest Lake Buttress.

content.description: Start with a few moves up the edge of a right-facing, hollow flake (this turns into a thin, hollow roof 10 feet up).  Leave the flake up and left to the route’s first bolt.  Continue past four more bolts to a two-bolt anchor on a headwall, 50 feet from the start. Lower or rappel 50 feet.  It is also possible to walk off to the right.
content.location: This route is 125 feet up and right from Tut Tut and Hieroglyphics. It is fairly easy to identify due to its start flake and protection bolts.

climbs.name: Hieroglyphics
climbs.fa: Duncan Masland, Brad Young, Shanna Hoversten, Joel Primrose, Jeff Germain, April 24, 2021

content.description: Climb the left-facing corner which defines the right edge of the slab, eight to ten feet right of Tut Tut. Finish at the shared three-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Micro to one two-inch piece and one fixed piton.
content.location: This corner defines the right edge of the 20 foot wide, west-facing slab that is the most prominent feature of the middle part of Pinecrest Lake Buttress.

content.description: Climb a thin, flaring, up-and-slightly-left crack just left from the start of RoZeu Route (listed next).  Traverse into the crack from the left (avoiding an otherwise steep, relatively blank start).  Finish from the top of the crack by following an up-and-right ramp across the top of RoZeu Route to its two-bolt top anchor. Lower or rappel 50 feet.  It is also possible to walk off to the right.
content.location: Cleo’s Crate and RoZeu Route are found 125 feet up and right from Tut Tut and Hieroglyphics (listed above).  They are above a flat area with small oak trees that is above a jumble of lesser rocks.  RoZeu Route is easy to identify because of its prominent start-flake and bolts.
